title: ima_sugu_onii-chan_ni_imouto_datte_iitai!
body:
Ima Sugu Oniichan ni Imouto da tte Iitai! ("I Want to Say to my Older Brother That I'm His Younger Sister Now!"), known as Imaimo for short, is a visual novel for PC and Playstation Vita developed by Fairys, with character designs by [[Akinashi Yuu]]. The manga adaption was illustrated by [[Oda Masaru]].

When [[Mitani Rikuto]]'s father remarries, Rikuto is given a cute [[mitani_ayumu|step-sister]] who, for various reasons, must pretend that she is male.

This series takes place in the same world as [[koi_to_senkyo_to_chocolate|Love, Elections & Chocolate]], a visual novel developed by Fairys' sister company, Sprite. The two games share some characters ([[Sumiyoshi Chisato]] and [[Shinonome Satsuki]]).

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ima_Sugu_Oniichan_ni_Im%C5%8Dto_da_tte_Iitai!]

title: freedom_wars
body:
Freedom Wars (フリーダムウォーズ Furīdamuwōzu) is a Japanese action role-playing video game developed by SCE Japan Studio exclusively for the PlayStation Vita.

Set in a post-apocalyptic Earth in the year 102014,the majority of humankind is imprisoned in penal city-states known as Panopticons undergorund which wage war against one another. Each person is born with a 1,000,000 years condamnation, and is considered a Sinner("Togabito") that has to fight to contribute to his society; exceptions are people that can contribute by other means, like engineers, who are considered citizens. The Sinners are essentially people who can't and are sent to fight since they can't be useful to their Panopticon in another way, and try to reduce the penalty years to 0 to become citizens.

You start the game as one of the Sinners who is working to purge his sentence.

title: fujiwara_no_teishi
body:
Fujiwara no Teishi (977–1001) was the first of two Empress consorts of Emperor Ichijou of Japan (一条天皇, 980-1011). She was the daughter of Fujiwara no Michitaka (藤原道隆, 953–995), Ichijou's uncle, making the two first cousins. 

She is featured in [i]The Pillow Book[/i], written by her lady-in-waiting, [[Sei Shounagon]]. 

h4.See also

title: this_war_of_mine
body:
This War of Mine is a 2014 war survival video game developed by 11 bit studios. It is inspired by the 1992-1996 Siege of Sarajevo during the Bosnian War and differs from most war-themed video games by focusing on the civilian experience of war rather than frontline combat.

This War of Mine is a survival-themed strategy game where the player controls a group of civilian survivors in a makeshift shelter in a besieged, war-torn city. The main goal of the game is to survive the war with the tools and materials the player can gather with the characters they control.

h4. External links

* "Official site":[http://www.11bitstudios.com/games/16/this-war-of-mine]
* "Wikipedia page":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/This_War_of_Mine]

title: viper's_creed
body:
[b]Viper's Creed[/b] (ヴァイパーズ・クリード [i]Vaipāzu Kurīdo[/i]) is a 2009 [[science fiction]] and [[mecha]] action anime series created by Sony Pictures Entertainment Japan with animation by AIC Spirits and Digital Frontier.

Kanbe Hiroyuki is the main director of the show, while [[Aramaki Shinji]] is responsible for the creation and conception of the series and some of its mecha designs. 

Viper's Creed first aired in Japan from January 6, 2009 to March 24, 2009 and lasted 12 episodes. G4 aired the show in America some time later, but later pulled it from the schedule after only four episodes.
other_names: ヴァイパーズ・クリード

body:
A simplified [[phone]], created by using paper cups or tin cans. There is a string attached to each phone, and the phone is used to communicate. Used mostly for play.
The device was sometimes called the "lovers' telephone".

title: sasha_(advance_wars)
body: Sasha (Japanese: サーシャ) is a Blue Moon CO and the older sister of Colin. She's normally ladylike, but becomes daring when she gets angry. Being the heiress to a vast fortune, she gets extra Funds from bases under her control. She has no weaknesses (or strengths, for that matter). She often watches over Colin, ensuring that his worry doesn't get too out of hand (but does come across as both domineering and heavy-handed with Colin). Also appears to have a thing for Jake in Dual Strike.

title: domino

title: mikado_shiina
body:
[[katawa_shoujo|Katawa Shoujo]] character.

Also known as "Misha", she is [[hakamichi shizune|Shizune's]] best friend and only fellow member in the student council. Misha serves as an interpreter for Shizune, who is deaf and mute, and is the first friend Hisao makes, being in the same class as him. She has long curls of pink hair and gold eyes. She is friendly and cheerful for the most part, though she is overly enthusiastic about everything she does, which tires everyone around her. She is not explicitly disabled, but she is attending Yamaku on a scholarship in order to become a sign language teacher.

title: tanatoria
body:
タナトリア

Character from [[Shinrabanshou]]'s 2009 storyline, the Ougarasen Chapter. A hero and black mage from 7 million years ago, brought back to life by the death god Necrominos and forced to fight on the side of evil. She and Hadias, her old companion in life who has suffered the same fate, despite their situation and dearly wish for someone to defeat Necrominos and free them from his control.

Her name is seemingly derived from Thanatos, the Greek god of death, and thus might also be romanized Thanatoria.

h4. Card:

* "Shikaisen Tanatoria":http://www.palusuke.com/list/ogarasen3/o058.html

title: velociraptor
body:
A carnivorous bipedal [[dinosaur]] that lived around 75-71 million years ago in Central Asia.

For tagging purposes this tag more accurately refers to dinosaurs from the [i]Dromaeosauridae[/i] (aka "Raptor") family of small to medium-sized dinosaurs, which contained [i]Velociraptor[/i] and related species. Members of this family varied in size from turkey size to full grown adult human height. Mass media has popularized lizard-like featherless depictions of these dinosaurs, though evidence suggests they were fully covered with down-like [[feathers]]. 

h4. See also 

* Wikipedia: "Dromaeosauridae":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dromaeosauridae 
* Wikipedia: "Velociraptor":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Velociraptor

title: kizuato
body:
"痕"(Kizuato, lit. "Scar") is a visual novel [[eroge]] created by [[leaf_(studio)|Leaf]] on 1996.
It was remade on 2002 and 2009.

Illustrations by [[Minazuki Tooru]] (first & second one) and [[Amami Mikihiro]] (third one)


h4.Characters

* [[Kashiwagi Kouichi]] (protagonist)
* [[Kashiwagi Chizuru]] (Kouichi's cousin, the oldest sister)
* [[Kashiwagi Azusa]] (the second sister)
* [[Kashiwagi Kaede]] (the third sister)
* [[Kashiwagi Hatsune]] (the youngest sister)

* [[Hiyoshi Kaori]] (Azusa's junior)
* [[Aida Kyouko]] (a reporter)
* [[Koide Yumiko]] (Kouichi's college classmate)
* [[Takasago Rikka]] (new character of 2009 version)

title: wright_flyer
body:
The [b]Wright Flyer[/b](often known as ether referred to as Flyer I or 1903 Flyer) was first successful powered aircraft, designed and built by the Wright bothers. Made its maiden flight on December 17, 1903 at Kitty Hawk, North Carolina. Making four test flights, all of which were successful. Longest flight was(fourth flight) about 852ft(or about 259.7m) lasting for 59 seconds but broke it front elevator due landing hard on the ground. 



[b]Reference[/b]
* Wikipedia: "Wright Flyer":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wright_Flyer
* Wright Brothers Aeroplane Company: "1903 Wright Flyer I":http://www.wright-brothers.org/Information_Desk/Just_the_Facts/Airplanes/Flyer_I.htm

title: alys
body:
Alys was supposed to be the first French Vocaloid, but was instead made for CeVIO Creative Studio. She was created by the development team VoxWave, and illustrated by Saphirya. She's currently still a prototype, but has already released four demos, "Dans mon monde", "Avenir", "Pr☆messe" and "Hajime ni", which are not made with CeVIO. Alys is able to sing and speak in French and Japanese.

Voxwave: http://www.voxwave.fr/

title: android_(elona)
body:
Servant of [[Mani of Machine]] in the game [[Elona]], they can become party members if the player has enough devotion in Mani.  

As their name implies, they are [[android]]s.  They are black metalic humaniod forms that do not appear terribly humanoid at all in the base game.  In Elona+, female androids have more humanoid features, with brown hair and a black uniform.  (Most artists seem to prefer base Elona, so androids generally appear as the robotic male form.)  When evolved, male androids have a [[Transformers|Transformers-like]] appearance, while female androids appear as [[mecha musume]].

Androids have the specialty of a self-targeting speed-and-stregth-boosting ability named "boost", but since all they can do otherwise is fire their guns, and the [[black_angel_(elona)|Black Angel]] has a better speed boost ability, they are generally considered inferior allies.

Like most Elona characters, android is just their "class name", and they have randomly generated personal names upon spawning.  As such, they would appear in-game as something like, "Selzuk the android".

title: okiku_(banchou_sarayashiki)
body:
Banchō Sarayashiki or Bancho Sarayashi[citation needed] (番町皿屋敷 The Dish Mansion at Banchō?) is a Japanese ghost story (kaidan) of broken trust and broken promises, leading to a dismal fate.

The story of Okiku and the Nine Plates is one of the most famous in Japanese folklore, and continues to resonate with audiences today.

title: yatterman
body:
The second and most popular entry in the [i][[time_bokan_(series)|Time Bokan]][/i] series, running from 1975-1977. [[Takada Gan]] and [[Kaminari Ai]] transform into the titular heroes and travel the world fighting off the Doronbo Gang, who want to collect Dokuro Stones in order to gain untold fortune.

Recieved a revival in 2008 (with the Doronbo Gang collecting rings this time), and a [[yoru_no_yatterman|sequel series]] in 2015.

title: kaitou_kiramekiman
body:
[b]Time Bokan 2000: Kaitou Kiramekiman[/b] (タイムボカン2000 怪盗きらめきマン [i]Taimubokan 2000 Kaitōkiramekiman[/i]) is the eighth installment in the [i][[time_bokan_(series)|Time Bokan]][/i] series. The story follows thieves as they travel through time to steal items, evading the Flower Detective agency at every turn. In reality, the thieving is done to preserve the future from what the stolen items might cause. 

The series ran for 26 episodes in 2000.

h4.Links
"Wikipedia Page":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Time_Bokan_2000:_Kaitou_Kiramekiman

title: drag-on_dragoon_3
body:
Drakengard 3, originally released in Japan as Drag-On Dragoon 3 (Japanese: ドラッグ オン ドラグーン3, commonly abbreviated as DOD3), is an action role-playing game developed by Access Games and published by Square Enix exclusively for the PlayStation 3. The game was released in December 2013 in Japan and in May 2014 in North America and Europe. It is the third game in the Drakengard series, and a prequel to the original game. The game, like the rest of the series, features a mixture of ground-based hack-and-slash combat and aerial battles. The story focuses on Zero, a mysterious woman who partners with a dragon named Mikhail to kill her five sisters, who rule the world's regions. As she travels, the player discovers the true reason behind Zero's rampage.

h4. Characters

* [[zero (drag-on dragoon)|Zero]]
* [[one (drag-on dragoon)|One]]
* [[two (drag-on dragoon)|Two]]
* [[three (drag-on dragoon)|Three]]
* [[four (drag-on dragoon)|Four]]
* [[five (drag-on dragoon)|Five]]
* [[mikhail (drag-on dragoon)|Mikhail]]
* [[Accord]]
other_names: ドラッグオンドラグーン3

title: binbo_taizou
body:
(びんぼ たいぞう)

A character from Kobayashi Yoshinori's manga series, "[[Obocchama-kun]]." Also known as 貧ぼっちゃま or びんぼっちゃま (Binbocchama).
He is [[Obou Chama]]'s friend. He is a son of downfallen formerly-rich family. Because he is incredibly poor, he can only afford the front half of a suit, and he ties strings on his back. Due to his great pride, he tries to wear a decent outfit, at least the front half of it. His catch phrase is "落ちぶれてすまん! (Sorry for coming down in the world!)"

All images having [[binbo taizou]] tag have [[backless outfit]] tag too. But the opposite isn't true. (E.g. post #702990 and post #546382)

If you want to use this tag, the image or the artist's [[commentary]] must contain his catch phrase, some references to him or a clear element of extreme [[poverty]].

h4.See also

* [[Obocchama-kun]]
* [[backless outfit]]

title: kako-hime
body:
[b]Princess Kako Akishino[/b] of Japan (秋篠宮佳子内親王殿下 [i]Akishino-no-miya Kako naishinnō denka[/i]; born 29 December 1994), the second daughter of Prince Akishino (Fumihito) and his wife, the former Kawashima Kiko, is a member of the Japanese imperial family. She is the second-born granddaughter of Emperor Akihito and Empress Michiko. Princess Kako is talented in riding the unicycle, figure skating, and origami. She is a big fan of the J-Pop group Puffy AmiYumi.

Princess Kako has one older sister, [[mako-hime|Princess Mako]], and a younger brother, Prince Hisahito.

Links:
* Wikipedia article: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Princess_Kako_of_Akishino

body: A female character from [[Sidonia No Kishi]], a [[science fiction]] [[mecha]] series. She is one of the [[Honoka sisters]], a series of [[clone|clones]], and is often seen with her elder [[sisters|sister]] [[Honoka En]]. She is friendly with the protagonist, [[Tanikaze Nagate]].

title: honoka_en
body:
A female character from [[Sidonia No Kishi]], a [[science fiction]] [[mecha]] series. She is the eldest of the [[Honoka sisters]], a series of [[clone|clones]], and is often seen with [[Honoka Ren]]. She has a strong punch.

Early fan art depicted her with albino [[white hair]] and [[white eyes]] before the first official color images were released. The Honoka [[sisters]] have since been officially drawn with [[pink hair]] and [[pink eyes]].

title: honoka_hou

title: honoka_sisters
body:
Female characters from [[Sidonia no Kishi]]. The [[sisters]] are [[clone|clones]], trained to be pilots. They have [[pink hair]] and [[pink eyes]]. 

Aside from the genetic modifications common among other residents of Sidonia, such as photosynthesis, the Honoka sisters also posses enhanced strength and accelerated maturation: the first series clones are chronologically five years old when the story begins, and the second series clones are only a year old when first introduced, yet they're all physically and mentally mature. 

There are two series of eleven clones each, for a total of twenty two clones.

h5. Honoka sisters

h6. First series

* [[Honoka En]]: eldest Honoka sister, trainee TS-203 and pilot 703.
* [[Honoka Hou]]: trainee TS-205 and pilot 705.

* Honoka Ro: pilot 707.
* Honoka You: pilot 708.

title: dodonpachi
body:
A shoot'em up game developed by [[cave (developer)|Cave]], known for its high difficulty and dark twist on how machines serve humanity.

1000 years ago, people created war machines to fight for them. However, technology overwhelmed humanity and soon everything was destroyed. To avoid such calamity from happening again, the people who survived sent the war machines to the moon and sealed them there. An eon has passed peacefully, but the war machines showed signs of unrest. To counter their onslaught, the federation amassed their forces and set off for the moon's capitol, Lunapolis.

h6.Games (chronological order)

* Donpachi
* Dodonpachi
* Dodonpachi II
* [[Dodonpachi Daioujou]]
* [[Dodonpachi Daifukkatsu]]
* [[Dodonpachi Saidaioujou]]

title: sima_yi
body:
Sima Yi (Zhongda) was a Cao Wei general and politician. His descendants eventually overthrew Wei, formed Jin and unified China for a brief period (until they were kicked southwards by northern invaders because of the state's own initial weakness and "civil war":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/War_of_the_Eight_Princes ).

In Romance of the Three Kingdoms, he was well known for his rivalry against [[Zhuge Liang]]. This is no different in [[Shin Sangoku Musou]]. His Yokoyama Mitsuteru counterpart is best known as the source of the "”Wait. Don't be upset. This is Zhuge Liang's trap”":/posts/243120 meme.

title: pang_tong
body:
Lived 179-214.

Late Han Dynasty Chinese advisor. Courtesy name Shiyuan(士元), Nicknamed "Fledgling Phoenix" (鳳雛).

An advisor to Liu Bei. He was known as a brilliant but unattractive man. He died from an arrow wound during Liu Bei's conquest of Yi province, which later became the center of power of Liu Bei's kingdom of Shu-Han.

This tag is usually used for his Dynasty Warriors/[[Shin Sangoku Musou]] portrayal as a short masked man with a large hat and some form of staff but can be used for other depictions as well.

title: catsister_(elona)
body:
[[catsister_(elona)|The Younger Cat Sister]] is a hidden character from [[Elona]].  They generally only appear after reading a very rare younger catsister's diary item.  As such, they are a rarer version of the [[younger_sister_(elona)|Younger Sister]] character.

Aside from the obvious [[cat ears]] and [[cat tail]], in-game, the main difference between a younger sister and a younger cat sister is that the cat sister has double the speed and one third the health.  

Salient characteristics of the cat sister are [[blue hair]], the aforementioned obvious catgirl features, [[hairpin]], [[blazer]] and [[pleated skirt]] as if from a Japanese middle/high school uniform, and dark [[thighhighs]].

Like most Elona characters, they are randomly named upon spawning, and Younger Cat Sister is just a class name.  In-game, they appear as something like "Anita the younger cat sister".

title: spiral_king_(elona)
body:
One of many [[cthulhu_mythos|Lovecraft]]-inspired monsters in [[Elona]], the spiral king is most notable for being one of the most powerful base creature classes in the entire vanilla game.  (Elona+ producing far more high-level content and much higher-level enemies.) 

They are notable for having not just spectacular stats, but also high-level magic, and the capacity to inflict insanity with a gaze.  

Spiral kings are creatures apparently made of twisting masses of [[tentacles]], with or without a mask as a "face", and are often used to make "tentacle" jokes when paired with female characters.  Like all pets/allies in Elona, you can actually marry and have children with spiral kings, and spiral kings can also be female.  (Not that gender matters for breeding purposes in Elona, anyway...)

title: cute_fairy_(elona)
body:
The [[cute_fairy_(elona)|Cute Fairy]] is the divine servant of [[Kumiromi of Harvest]], one of the deities of [[Elona]].  Cute fairies have the special ability to spit out seeds when they eat, making them a boon for farming players.

Like many characters in Elona, "cute fairy" is merely a "class" of characters, and has a randomly generated name given to them upon spawning into the world.  (For example, "Finola the cute fairy".)

The cute fairy by default has [[green hair]], a white dress, yellow hair ribbon, [[fairy wings]], and is quite small... except when you notice that their in-game stats say they're actually human-sized, because their size is race-based, and all servants have the Servant race template.

In spite of their appearance, cute fairies can be either male or female.  In Elona+, cute fairies have gender-based evolutions to either the (female) Dryas (presumably, a corruption of "[[dryad]]"), or the (male) Deathscythe.

title: larnneire
body:
A character from [[Elona]].  Larnneire and [[Lomias]] are the two NPCs that you meet when you start the game.

She is titled "The Listener of Wind", and has a major involvement in the plot of the game.  She is an envoy from the [[elf|Elea]], seeking to speak with the king of the land the game is set in, only to face multiple complications in that quest.  

She has [[blue_hair]] of shoulder-length, elven-style pointed ears, and a green-and-white dress and blouse.

title: lulwy_of_wind
body:
Lulwy of Wind is the goddess of speed, the sky, and weather in [[Elona]].  Possibly because of the dreaded Etherwind in Elona, (which mutates and deforms creatures into monsters,) Lulwy's personality is cruel and sadistic.  (Or possibly, the Etherwind is possible to exist of because the personality of Lulwy - it's not quite clear.)

She typically appears essentially [[nude]], wrapped only in a blue shawl that is worn so loosely it doesn't cover much of anything.  She has great white feathery [[wings]], short [[blue hair]] in-game, although many artists show it as a different color, and [[large breasts]].  She often wields her signature weapon, a [[bow_(weapon)|bow]].

She prefers to talk down to the player as being her "slave" or "pet".  (Which is somewhat ironic, considering how the player often treats their allies as pets, themselves, and are infamous for putting their allies on leashes or buying them from slave traders.)

Her preferred sacrifices are bows.

Her servants are the [[black_angel_(elona)|black angels]].

title: cafeteria
body: A dining facility in large institution like a school, office, camp, hospital etc. where the members of that institution come to eat, although public cafeterias exist, mostly as a cheap dining option. Cafeterias usually consist of a serving counter or counters along one wall near the entrance where one pushes along a tray and is served portions of food by the staff. The rest of the room usually consists of seating often consisting of large multi-seat tables. The cafeteria fare generally consists of a few set meals of an entree and various side dishes to complement that entree, often there is a flat fee for a meal, although one is charged for extra portions or optional dishes like deserts. Another common price scheme is each dish has it's own price and a customer chooses which dishes to purchase. Commonly a cafeteria will have a main line (or lines) consisting of a hot meal at a flat price and an a la cart line consisting of individually priced dishes like salads and sandwiches.  It's probably noisy, and the food probably sucks. A cliche is the school cafeteria being segregated according to group membership, e.g. cool kids, outcasts, nerds, jocks, etc...

title: punch_line
body:
A Spring 2015 noitaminA original anime series.

The story is about Iridatsu Yuuta, a high school student who lives in an apartment building with 3 girls and a young woman. He has the peculiar problem of becoming excited and gaining superhuman abilities when he sees women's underwear. Also if he sees women's underwear again while in this excited state it also causes him to become overexcited and faint.  Further complicating things is that after a bus hijacking incident a spirit possessed his body and left him now as a wandering spirit.  He now has to figure out how to regain his body, all while having to avoid getting overexcited and fainting, as for some reason it causes an asteroid to hit the Earth and wipe out all life.

h6. Characters

* [[Daihatsu Meika]]
* [[Hikiotani Ito]]
* [[Narugino Mikatan]]

title: fujiwara_cocoa_(mangaka)
body:
[b]Cocoa Fujiwara[/b] (藤原 ここあ [i]Fujiwara Kokoa[/i]) was a Japanese manga author and illustrator from Fukuoka Prefecture. Her debut was with a work called [i]Calling[/i], which she made when she was only fifteen after dropping out of high school to become a mangaka; she is best known for [i][[Inu x Boku SS]][/i]. She was good friends with [[mochizuki_jun|Jun Mochizuki]] and [[toboso_yana|Yana Toboso]].

She passed away due to illness in March 31 2015, leaving [i][[Katsute Mahou Shoujo to Aku wa Tekitai Shiteita]][/i] unfinished.

For her artist tag see [[Fujiwara Cocoa]].

title: johannes_(bloodstained)
body:
A member of the defunct Alchemist guild and Gebel’s best friend. 
Johannes was the only Alchemist who dissented with the plan to call demons to the earth to cement Alchemy as the prevalent philosophy. 
His rejection of the other Alchemists’ scheme is what kept him from sharing their fate. 
He has a vague understanding that Miriam’s awakening and the demon castle’s appearance are no mere coincidence.

title: morishita_kanako
body:
Character in [i][[Akabanzu]][/i].

She has [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]].


h4. Profile

From [1]
[quote]
T155 B83(C) W58 H81
AB型 6月23日生まれ

都会と言うか華やかな暮らしに憧れている田舎の少女。
夢はアイドルになること。
と、言う事で由貴が転向してきた事により、アイドルになるコツを聞きたくてつきまとう。

蛍とは昔からの友人で、蛍が村での暮らしを普通だと思っているのとは反対に、加奈子は出て行きたくて仕方がない。
スタイリッシュさに憧れてラクロス部に入ったりもするが、あまり運動神経はよろしくなくチーム内では足手まといな存在。

エミーの教育係を買って出て、間違った知識を教えまくる困ったちゃん。

「いつでも可愛くいないとアイドルじゃないから」
そんな私服は勘違いしたゴスロリで、そのまま田んぼのあぜ道を歩いたり、農作業を手伝っていたりする。 
[/quote]


h4. Links

* [1] "Character profile":http://bonbon-company.com/product/02/page_ch/ch_06.html

title: tatsuki_tsubasa
body:
Character in [i][[Akabanzu]][/i].

She has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]].


h4. Profile

From [1]
[quote]
T160 B?? W?? H??
O型 4月4日生まれ

主人公の幼なじみ。そこまででなくとも古い付き合いの友人。
小さな頃から線が細く、整った顔立ちから女の子に間違われることが多かった。

女の子に憧れを抱いていて、家には女の子向けのファッション雑誌ばかり。
主人公に淡い思いを抱いているが、アプローチが出来ない。本人は今のままの関係で言いと思っている。

アルファはプレイしていて、主人公は気がつかないが、実際は同じギルドに所属する女性キャラを使っている。
女の子になりたい。そんな夢をかなえてくれるネトゲの世界にはまっている。

更正プログラムに導かれるクエストを主人公と一緒にクリア＝アカバン。
本当の自分になれる場所を失い、落ち込み方は主人公に匹敵する。

「お前もアカバンされたのか」
「うん」

そこで、一緒にプレイしていたキャラの中の人が翼だと知り、主人公は驚愕する。
「ぜんぜん気がつかなかった！」
気持ち悪いとは言わずに、むしろ完璧に演じきったことに感心するような言動。

「お前が女の子だったら、絶対に放っておかなかった」

冗談交じりの一言だが、それが女の子への憧れをリアルでも実行するきっかけに。
更正プログラムへの参加を決意し、「男の娘」として主人公と共に、学園生活をスタートすることになる。 
[/quote]


h4. Links

* [1] "Character profile":http://bonbon-company.com/product/02/page_ch/ch_05.html

title: emii_(akabanzu)
body:
Character in [i][[Akabanzu]][/i].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]], [[pointy ears]], and [[green eyes]].


h4. Profile

From [1]
[quote]
T165 B85(D) W57 H85
A型 4月26日生まれ

人気ＭＭＯＲＰＧアルファの、いわゆる進行役。

開始時はチュートリアルのサポートなどで、プレイヤーにはお馴染み。
中盤以降はクエストの進行役などで、ログインすれば必ず何らかの形で目に触れることになる。
学習能力を兼ね備えていて、アルファの性質を生かしたプレイヤーの徹底分析により相手を不快にさせない会話能力を保持している。

基本はいつも笑顔で、ムリを言われても少し困ったような様子を見せる程度。
少なくともゲーム中で彼女の怒った顔を見たことがあるプレイヤーは存在しない。ぴったりとした装束は豊満なバディを浮かび上がらせる。
言葉遣いもとても丁寧、会社の受付嬢のレベルで徹底している。
とはいえ、機械的ということはなく、相手にあわせた受け答えに「中の人」はどうなってるんだとの疑問はつきない。

主人公達が学園に転入後、アルファのマザーコンピューターの暴走により、「なぜか」実体化してしまう。

知識はネット経由で豊富なのだが、やはり実践の仕方を間違ってしまう。
また、基本の知識がＲＰＧ基準なので、色々とずれている。
女の子の部屋のタンスをあさって、「アイテムゲットです！」はお約束。
[/quote]


h4. Links

* [1] "Character profile":http://bonbon-company.com/product/02/page_ch/ch_04.html

title: hirata_hotaru
body:
Character in [i][[Akabanzu]][/i].

She has [[black hair]] in [[twintails]].


h4. Profile

From [1]
[quote]
T156 B78(A) W54 H82
O型 8月17日生まれ

更生プログラムを行う学園に通う現地の住人。

都会へのやや勘違いした憧れを抱いている。
通信手段やネットのレベルが、２０世紀レベル。
携帯もメール機能なしのものを使っており、試しにメールを打たせてみたら日が暮れるような女の子。

ネットを通じて人と繋がる概念がない。そーしゃるねっとわーく？何それ、外国のお菓子？おいしいの？

実家は農家で、毎日のように農作業を手伝う、真面目で良い子。
お気に入りの麦わら帽子があり、私服のときは必ずかぶっている。
ただ無防備な面が有り、私服時はノーブラで、乳首が浮いちゃったり、服の隙間から見えちゃったり。
華奢に見えても、家業を手伝っているので案外力持ち。
基礎体力も高く険しい山道も何のその、座り生活の長い主人公よりも長い時間歩いても平然としている。

田舎の娘なのに、虫が苦手で、「足が６本なんて生物の常識から外れていますよ！」などと叫びます。
上記の理由で、蜘蛛はどうやら苦手ではない模様。

また田舎の一大イベント「お祭り」が大好きで、「祭り小町」の異名をとる。
金魚すくいや射的は神業レベル。
[/quote]


h4. Links

* [1] "Character profile":http://bonbon-company.com/product/02/page_ch/ch_02.html

title: tsujiuchi_yuki
body:
Character in [i][[Akabanzu]][/i].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[red hair]].


h4. Profile

From [1]
[quote]
T161 B87(E) W58 H86
A型 2月14日生まれ

現在売り出し中のアイドル。

世間の知名度はそれほど高くないが、その抜群の容姿と、人当たりの良さで若い層にはかなりの認知度がある。
主なお仕事は、グラビア。ＣＤデビューの話は何度もあるが、なぜか直前で消えている。
実は致命的な音痴で、マネージャーからは人前で歌うことを絶対に禁止されている。

そんな彼女の知名度を上げたのは、年末のインテリ芸能人クイズ大会。
現役の学生でありながら有識者を次々と沈め決勝まで残る大奮戦が話題になった。
なお、決勝では惜しいところで敗れる辺りが、それがまたアイドル性を高めるにいたった。

恋愛映画への参加が決まるが、恋愛経験がまるでない彼女は役作りがまるでできない。
更正プログラムで、主人公の相手役を務めることを提案され、ネトゲ仲間の中で一番興味がある主人公との接触と、演技にプラスになる経験を手に入れられると思い参加を決意する。

アルファは仕事の合間にやるので、主にアバターを使ったチャットツールとして使っている。
妙に気があう人（主人公）がいたので、ギルドにも所属し合間にはモバイルでチャットを楽しむ程度。
ギルドそのものはガチギルドと思われがちだが、ライトな層も歓迎している。
なお、自分に起こった出来事を若干改変して伝えているので、ギルドメンバーには超お金持ちのお嬢様と思われている。（海外にグラビア撮影に行けば海外旅行にいった等）
アルファにはそれ程執着はなかったが、ギルドメンバーと会えなくなったことは寂しいく、ギルドメンバーが多くそのプログラムに参加すると聞かされ、更生プログラムに参加する。 
[/quote]


h4. Links

* [1] "Character profile":http://bonbon-company.com/product/02/page_ch/ch_01.html

title: tsuru_iori
body:
Character in [i][[Akabanzu]][/i].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[silver hair]].


h4. Profile

From [1]
[quote]
T149 B89(F) W55 H88
B型 10月28日生まれ

主人公以上にアルファに夢中なギルドリーダー。

アルファでは個性的な面子をまとめあげていた。
ネットの中では面倒見もよく、更に最強のキャラと腕前で、主人公も憧れる伝説レベルのプレイヤー。

性別が違う役を演じていたが、あまりに堂々としていて誰も女子だとは気がつかなかった。
誰よりもアルファに夢中になっていたために、キャラクタを取り戻すことに執着している。
そのために、「運動部に所属しろ」という更生プログラムを、ぶつぶつ言いながらもこなしている。

「なんで、わたしがこんなことしないといけないんですか」

口調は同年代にも敬語だが、決して丁寧を意識させる敬語ではない。
当然のように、主人公をキャラクタの名前で呼ぶありさま。
[/quote]


h4. Links

* [1] "Character profile":http://bonbon-company.com/product/02/page_ch/ch_03.html

title: otoha_kowalska
body:
The "Non-traditional western Goddess". Fan-created character by Meron and Gen. 

Otoha is the Goddess living peacefully in Human Village. She had a brother before she became a Goddess rank, but he died shortly before her ascension. She came to the Gensokyo about 100 years before the barrier has separate Gensokyo from Outside World. Because of her religion view, she hates everything about Remilia Scarlet and SDM. Her power is to manipulate Divine Matter and Psychical Matter, which means, she can destroy anything what she want or create.  
 
Her appearance is strongly based on Saint Mary, especially veils in her design. She wears a pansy on her head, which is her favourite flower. The main motif of her appearance is fusion of Slavic and Polish legends with Christianity. She wields a powerful and legendary, polish sword named Sincererun (誠実な実行).  Her name is written in katakana (which means nothing) but also she has a meaning variety. Name Otoha - 音羽 (sound,feather) might be a reference to the Christianity angels etc. while her surname is nothing more than one of the most popular surnames in present Poland, which can be translated as Smith or Yamada.

For now, she don't have any appearance in game, but creators want to change it.

title: kagura_kokone
body:
[[Original]] character by [[Sakuragi Rian]]. Also known as Kokone (ココネ) or Koko (狐々).

She is a newbie [[inari]] deity with [[blonde_hair|blonde]] [[long hair]], [[fox ears]], [[multiple_tails|multiple]] [[fox_tail|fox tails]], and a [[huge_ahoge|long, long]] front [[ahoge]]. She has an ability to conceal her extra tails.

Her "prototype" version appeared in "his 2013 doujin":[http://cynthia.cc/asakura/doujin/koko8.html]. This "Koko":[http://cynthia.cc/asa/koko/koko_inari.jpg.php] is not an inari, but a [[kitsune|youkai fox]].
A character with the same name (post #1406685) appeared in "his 2012 doujin":[http://cynthia.cc/asakura/doujin/suitei.html]. She is probably herself in the distant future ("802701 A.D.":[https://twitter.com/cynthia_koko/status/324490550034182145]).

title: ibarahime_shizuka
body:
Character from [[Shinrabanshou]]'s 2010 storyline, Zex Factor. Full name Saeki Shizuka (冴樹志津香), "Ibarahime" is her title meaning "Thorn Princess". An 18-year old Ryuujin (a horned dragon race) who attends Houou Academy's Seiryuu Class 3 and serves as the student council vice president. Considers [[Homura Kai]], main character and new arrival at the school, to be a possible danger because of his unique abilities. She has the power to heal others and manipulate plants, and her "beast soul" partner is an immature form of [[Hanahime Kaguya]].

title: yakuza_tengu
body:
A ninja hunter in [[Ninja Slayer]].
He is a [[cyborg]], but is not possessed by a ninja soul.
He wears a black yakuza [[suit]] and a [[tengu mask]], carries a [[jet pack]] and [[dual_wielding|dual]] "automatic yakuza [[handgun|guns]]".
He has been fighting against [[ninja|ninjas]] since long before the re-birth of [[Fujikido Kenji]] as the Ninja Slayer. As a result, he is completely mentally deranged and  believes that he is a sinner who unleashed countless ninja souls into today's Japan.

title: zucchini_(vegetable)
body:
A cylindrical, usually green, summer squash. While originally from the Americas, the zucchini was cultivated to its present-day form in Italy.

Because of its color and shape, it is sometimes confused with a [[cucumber]]. A zucchini's peel is rougher and less bumpy, and its flesh has a completely different taste than that of a cucumber.

Also referred to as "courgette."

title: aschen_brodel
body:
A supporting protagonist in Super Robot Taisen - OG Saga: Endless Frontier.

She is basically [[Harken Browning]]'s girl (or should that be gynoid?) Friday.

Has a super mode when she overheats - the green components of her clothing disintegrate and her demeanor changes completely from calm and snarky to extremely energetic.

Uses her fists and feet in combat, her punches having greater range than normal due to being wire-guided.

[spoiler]She's actually W-07 of the Shadow Mirror's W-series of androids, and is possibly a template for the later W-17 ([[Lamia Loveless]]).[/spoiler]

Her VA is [[Shimizu Kaori]], just like her "younger sister".

title: dragon_quest_i
body:
The first in the long-running [i][[Dragon Quest]][/i] series of video games.  Although a very simple game by modern standards, it did establish many of the modern tropes of console RPGs.

It was originally released in 1986 for the [[Famicom]], and brought to North America in 1990, though its name was changed to [i]Dragon Warrior[/i] in that market due to a previous copyright on the [i]Dragon Quest[/i] title.  The game has since been ported and enhanced numerous times, with versions being made for the [[Super Famicom]], [[Game Boy Color]], and mobile devices.

title: dragon_quest_ix
body:
[i]Dragon Quest IX: Hoshizora no Mamoribito[/i] (ドラゴンクエストX 目覚めし五つの種族 オンライン) (Dragon Quest IX: Sentinels of the Starry Skies) is the ninth game in the [i][[Dragon Quest]][/i] series of RPGs. It was released on the [[Nintendo DS]] in Japan in 2009, and in the rest of the world in 2010.

It was the first game of the [i]Dragon Quest[/i] series to feature multiplayer gameplay, and the first to be initially released (rather than as a port) for a handheld console.

title: matilda_(angry_birds)
body:
[b]Matilda, a.k.a. the White Bird. [/b]

White Bird is a character in the [i][[Angry Birds]][/i] series of video games. She is an original member of the Flock, the core group of birds fighting against the [[Bad Piggies]].

Within the game, Matilda's special ability is to drop explosive eggs, blasting everything down below.

Matilda is a [[Chicken]].

title: loyter_the_crimson_of_zanan
body:
A plot NPC in [[Elona]], Loyter is a general of Zanan, however, in the game, he is most known as the "bane of bards".  

Playing music in Elona is based upon a comparison of your skill check to the level of the nearby NPCs.  High-level NPCs take high skill to please, and if they are displeased by your performance, they will throw rocks at you to stop you.  Loyter is infamous for being very high level, sticking around the starting town, and having enough strength to kill a level 1 player with his first rock.  Beyond that, he frequently splatters the NPC bard that starts in the bar he frequents while off-screen from the player, meaning even if the player isn't killed, you always see a bard getting murdered by Loyter.  

To make things worse, he's a frequent guest at Party Time! events, where the player must succeed in pleasing multiple guests with music, and is again very high-leveled to the point where winning these quests often involves finding ways to hide from Loyter or die.  

Loyter has [[red hair]], as would be expected of the name, [[green eyes]], as well as a red [[cloak]] and [[armor]].

title: jian_(weapon)
body:
Traditional Chinese 劍
Simplified Chinese 剑

A double-edged straight Chinese [[sword]] of 45 to 80 centimeters (17.7 to 31.5 inches) in length, with a one- or two-handed grip, a tapering, pointed blade, and a pommel that is sometimes decorated with a [[tassel]]. Jian are still used in [[martial arts]] today.

h4. See also

* [[Dao]] - Chinese single-edged swords
* [[List of weapons]]
* "Wikipedia article":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jian

title: dao
body:
Hanji: 刀

Chinese single-edged [[sword|swords]].

The most common type is the "liuye-dao":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Liuyedao] (柳叶刀/柳葉刀, literally ”willow leaf blade”). It is similar to a [[scimitar]]. In Japan it is often called 青竜刀/青龍刀 that was originally a Chinese abbreviation for [[Guan Yu]]'s "Green Dragon Crescent Blade":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Green_Dragon_Crescent_Blade (青龍偃月刀).

See also:

* [[Jian (weapon)]] - Chinese double-edged straight swords
* [[List of weapons]]
* "Wikipedia article":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dao_%28sword%29

title: gekkou_(irem)
body:
The main protagonist of the [[Saigo No Nindou]] ([i]Ninja Spirit[/i]) action arcade video game created by [[Irem]] in 1988.

[B]Gekkou[/B] (月光 [i]Gekkou[/i]), is a very young (but also very skilled) [[ninja]] warrior who lost his father to a mysterious half-man half-beast creature, so he embarks in a mission of revenge during ancient times in feudal Japan.

title: saigo_no_nindou
body:
[b]Saigo no Nindou[/b] (最後の忍道 [i]Saigou no Nindou[/i]), known outside of Japan as [b]Ninja Spirit[/b], is a 1988 platform, hack-and-slash, action arcade video game developed and published by [[Irem]].

The game's hero, [[gekkou_(irem)|Gekkou]], is a young ninja who lost his father to a mysterious half-man half-beast creature. The plot of Ninja Spirit is based on the quest of his revenge in an alternative feudal Japan.

Ninja Spirit was successfully ported onto multiple platforms. The most popular port is the [[pc_engine|TurboGrafx-16]] format which includes two styles of mode: the PC Engine mode which provides a lengthy healthbar, and the Arcade mode, which is a more challenging mode where the ninja dies with the slightest contact. That version was ported to the [[Nintendo]] [[Wii]]'s Virtual Console on May 14, 2007, was delisted on March 30, 2012 and was available again on September 17, 2013 in Japan and on September 19, 2013 in North America and Europe.

Ninja Spirit later appeared in the Japan-only [[Game Boy]] title, Shuyaku Sentai Irem Fighter along with other characters from the game, as well as characters from three other Irem franchises: [[R-Type]], Mr. Heli and Hammerin' Harry.

Ninja Spirit for the Turbografx-16 is notable because it was the first game in history to receive a perfect score (10) in a video game magazine, "The 1991 Video Game Buyer's Guide by Electronic Gaming Monthly, in 1990.":http://www.defunctgames.com/reviewcrew/24/ninja-spirit-what-did-the-critics-say-in-1990

title: mikuni_oriko
body:
The White Magical Girl. A prophet [[magical girl]] and title character of [[Mahou Shoujo Oriko Magica]].

Her magical girl costume consists of an elaborate [[white dress]] and a [[shako_cap|shako]]-like [[hat]] with twin [[veil|veils]] streaming from it. Her brooch-like silver [[soul gem]] is worn just below her neck, on the collarbone. Her power is to see the future, which she uses in battle as well as for long-term planning. Her weapons are small, ivy-patterned [[orb|orbs]] she summons and controls.

[spoiler]She orchestrates a magical girl massacre and [[Chitose Yuma]]'s contract to distract [[Kyubey]] from contracting [[Kaname Madoka]], and by proxy, preventing the birth of [[Kriemhild Gretchen]]. She succeeds by killing Madoka herself.[/spoiler]

title: mahou_shoujo_taisen
body:
[i]Mahou Shoujo Taisen[/i], (officially translated as [i]Magica Wars[/i], and literally 'Magical Girl Wars') "is a media franchise created by the internet television variety show 2.5 Dimension TV. ... The franchise personifies Japan's 47 prefectures, each one being represented by a magical girl. The character designs are determined via a contest on the art website Pixiv. The voice actress for each girl was born in the prefecture that they represent." [1]

h4. See also
